SEARCH
Package game

Class Level

java.lang.Object
game.Level
public final class Level extends Object
A level consists in a map, waves and a game loop to get through for the player

  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level(String levelName) throws map.InvalidMapException, map.InvalidMapPathException, InvalidLevelException, map.NoEnemySpawnException, map.MultipleEnemySpawnException
      Constructor of level
      Parameters:
      levelName - the identifier of the level, see in assets/levels to add more
      Throws:
      map.InvalidMapException - if the map's loading fails
      map.InvalidMapPathException - if the map's path is unreadable
      InvalidLevelException - if the level file is corrupted
      map.NoEnemySpawnException - if there is no enemy spawn
      map.MultipleEnemySpawnException - if there is multiple enemy spawns

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(String levelName) throws map.InvalidMapException, map.InvalidMapPathException, InvalidLevelException, map.NoEnemySpawnException, map.MultipleEnemySpawnException
      Effective constructor of level, loads the map, the waves and checks for errors in resource files
      Parameters:
      levelName - the identifier of the level, see in assets/levels to add more
      Throws:
      map.InvalidMapException - if the map's loading fails
      map.InvalidMapPathException - if the map's path is unreadable
      InvalidLevelException - if the level file is corrupted
      map.NoEnemySpawnException - if there is no enemy spawn
      map.MultipleEnemySpawnException - if there is multiple enemy spawns

    • getNearbyAllies

      public List<units.Unit> getNearbyAllies(units.Unit unit, float maxDistance)
      Allows to get all surrounding allies of a unit, has O(n) complexity
      Parameters:
      unit - the origin of the research
      maxDistance - the radius to look for allies
      Returns:
      all allies within maxDistance from the origin

    • getNearest

      public units.Unit getNearest(units.Unit unit, float maxDistance, units.AttackMode filter)
      Look for unit's nearest enemy respecting the given filter, has O(n) complexity
      Parameters:
      unit - the origin of the research
      maxDistance - the radius to look enemies for
      filter - the search criteria (tankiest, weakest, just nearest...)
      Returns:
      the nearest enemy respecting filter

      Parameters:

    • start

      public boolean start() throws units.UninitializedSpawner
      The level's loop, pushes all enemies waves and waits
      Returns:
      whether the player is victorious or not
      Throws:
      units.UninitializedSpawner - if the spawner could not load its waves

    • startWave

      public boolean startWave()
      Ticks one wave, this method exists for the sole purpose of reducing indentation level of the game loop. First manages mouse events, then ticks entities and lastly draws the result. Uses timers to cap frame rate, this is awful but just works :tm:
      Returns:
      whether the player was victorious or not
